thread.title: Rising Seas Threaten to Flood Launch Sites, NASA Says
thread.title_full: Rising Seas Threaten to Flood Launch Sites, NASA Says

title: Rising Seas Threaten to Flood Launch Sites, NASA Says
text:
Get Business & Technology Alerts 
5 Sep 2015 12:22 PM EST 
NASA's rockets are astounding machines, capable of blasting into space at thousands of miles per hour and withstanding temperatures twice the melting point of steel. But they can't take off underwater. Rising sea levels caused by melting ice caps threaten to disrupt a handful of NASA launch sites along U.S. coastlines, the space agency warns. NASA says, In the coming years, launch facilities at Florida's Kennedy Space Center and other places may need to be retrofitted or even moved inland.
